title: Wall Street Is Shaking Off Fears of an A.I. Bubble. For Now.
summary: The valuations of some artificial intelligence companies are approaching those of the dot-com boom. But investors worry that pulling money from today’s market risks future gains.

title: Why the A.I. Boom Is Unlike the Dot-Com Boom
summary: Silicon Valley is again betting everything on a new technology. But the mania is not a reboot of the late-1990s frenzy.

title: Judge Says Ghislaine Maxwell Grand Jury Records Can Be Unsealed, Citing New Epstein Law
summary: The ruling cited a law signed last month by President Trump requiring the Justice Department to release its files on Jeffrey Epstein and his longtime companion, Ghislaine Maxwell.

title: Legal Groups Sue Justice Dept. for Secret Memo Justifying Boat Strikes
summary: “The public deserves to know how the Trump administration has justified the outright murder of civilians as lawful,” the organizations said in their lawsuit.

title: Judge Suggests Lindsey Halligan, Prosecutor on Comey and James Cases, Should Resign
summary: Lindsey Halligan’s indictments against James B. Comey, the former F.B.I. director, and Letitia James, the attorney general of New York, were dismissed last month over Ms. Halligan’s appointment.

title: Why Trump Accounts, as Currently Planned, Risk Leaving Out Many Children
summary: Michael and Susan Dell are donating $6.25 billion to American children via the accounts, but the details matter.

title: Mackenzie Scott Announces $7 Billion of Giving This Year
summary: The philanthropist known for donating to historically Black colleges and nonprofits working on climate change offered the news by updating an October blog post.

title: In L.A., $750 a Month to Live in a Backyard Storage Unit
summary: A landlord crowded tenants into his house and yard without running water or power. One, determined to find an alternative, was up against the city’s housing crisis.

title: 2025 Best Dishes in America
summary: Crispy fish ssam, knife-cut noodles and more of our favorite bites from a year of eating.

title: 2025 Best Desserts in America
summary: Dulce de leche flan, cherry pie and more of our favorite sweets of the year.

title: Trump Calls Europe ‘Decaying’ and Suggests ‘Size Will Win’ in Ukraine War
summary: President Trump’s comments deepened his rift with mainstream European leaders over defense and Ukraine policy.

title: The Territorial Sticking Point Between Russia and Ukraine
summary: The Kremlin says any peace deal must cede to Russia the entire eastern Donbas region, including territory Ukraine still controls — a nonstarter for Kyiv.

title: Kamala Harris Isn’t Ready to Be Written Off
summary: She was seen for two decades as a future face of the Democratic Party. Is she now suddenly a figure of its past?

title: Canada Plans to Fast-Track Immigration for US H1-B Visa Holders in New Talent Drive
summary: The government says it will fast-track immigration for U.S. H-1B visa holders and spend more than $1 billion to attract researchers from the United States and the rest of the world.

title: Gov. Pritzker Signs Bill Imposing New Limits on Immigration Enforcement in Illinois
summary: The measure restricts immigration arrests around state courthouses. Republicans have criticized the law and suggested it would face legal challenges.

title: What Streaming TV Could Learn from ‘Mad Men’
summary: The classic show arrived on HBO Max with an embarrassing remastering error. But the show’s creative mastery remains undeniable.

title: Australia’s Social Media Ban for People Under 16 Takes Effect
summary: The measure is one of the most sweeping efforts in the world to safeguard children from the harms of the platforms.

title: Some Teens Are on Social Media ‘Almost Constantly,’ Survey Says
summary: The new Pew report also found that two-thirds of teens said they had used an A.I. chatbot.

title: Europe, Too, Is Worth Fighting For
summary: Provided Europeans want to fight for it.

title: Trump Pressures Ukraine
summary: Also, the Supreme Court considers campaign finance limits. Here’s the latest at the end of Tuesday.

title: Student Is Killed in Kentucky State University Shooting
summary: The police said that a suspect was arrested after the shooting in Frankfort, Ky. A second student was injured and in critical but stable condition, a university spokesman said.

title: Seattle’s Plans for a Pride Match at World Cup Infuriates Iran and Egypt
summary: The two countries, which criminalize homosexuality and impose severe punishments for it, were picked to play on a day celebrating L.G.B.T.Q. communities.

title: DéLana R.A. Dameron, Writer of the Black South, Dies at 40
summary: An award-winning poet and writer of fiction, she moonlighted as a competitive horsewoman and owned a horse farm outside Columbia, S.C.

title: Bird Flu Is Suspected After Vulture Carcasses Sat Rotting Outside Ohio School
summary: The birds lingered for days at a Catholic school near Cincinnati as agencies haggled over who was responsible for removing them. Officials said the public health risk was low.
